CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 8, 1951, pg. 2 reads: "Davis Murder Trial - Mrs. Stella Davis, 43-year-old Bridgeville woman, is led from a Criminal Courtroom Wednesday during a recess in her two-day trial before Judge John J. Kennedy and a jury of seven men and five women. Mrs. Davis is charged with the slaying of her husband, Andrew, last Aug. 20, following a quarrel, but claims she fired upon him in self defense. - Tennie [Teenie] Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Woman escorting Stella Davis through corridor in the Allegheny County Courthouse during trial recess
